meanings.definition: A small farm or plot of land, especially in East Africa.
meanings.sent1: The farmer tended to his shamba every morning.
meanings.sent2: The shamba was filled with rows of crops.
meanings.sent3: The goats thought the shamba was a playground.
meanings.sent4: Her shamba was a green oasis in the dry landscape.
meanings.sent5: Children played hide-and-seek in the shamba.

meanings.definition: A rural agricultural area or village.
meanings.sent1: The shamba was a peaceful place to live.
meanings.sent2: People in the shamba worked together to harvest crops.
meanings.sent3: The shamba had a lively market every weekend.
meanings.sent4: The shamba was like a close-knit family.
meanings.sent5: The shamba bustled with activity during planting season.

meanings.definition: To cultivate or work on a shamba.
meanings.sent1: She would shamba the land to grow vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The farmers shambaed from sunrise to sunset.
meanings.sent3: He decided to shamba the field with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: They shambaed the soil until it was rich and fertile.
meanings.sent5: Shambaing required dedication and hard work.
